  "description": "Excel and Grace Consulting is a fast-paced business consulting organization with a track record of delivering exceptional business solutions to small and medium-scale enterprises in Nigeria, Ghana, Germany, Switzerland, Canada, etc. We are certified management consultants with the International Council of Management Consulting Institutes (CMC-Global) with over 18 years of experience. Our team of experts and consultants have authored over 20 books on business management, business structure, business operations, human resources, organizational structure, employee development, money management, and so on.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: General Manager

Job Location:&nbsp;Port Harcourt, Rivers
Employment Type: Full-time
Reports To: Managing Director / Executive Management

Job Summary


	The General Manager will be responsible for overseeing the overall operations, performance, and profitability of the hotel.
	This role requires a dynamic and experienced hospitality professional with strong leadership, financial, and operational management skills.
	The ideal candidate will ensure the hotel delivers an exceptional guest experience while meeting business goals and maintaining brand standards.


Key Responsibilities
Strategic &amp; Operational Leadership:


	Provide strategic direction for the hotel&rsquo;s daily operations, ensuring all departments (front office, housekeeping, food &amp; beverage, maintenance, etc.) function efficiently.
	Develop and implement operational plans to improve service delivery and overall guest satisfaction.
	Ensure compliance with company policies, hospitality standards, and regulatory requirements.


Financial Management:


	Prepare and manage annual budgets, forecasts, and financial reports.
	Monitor revenue streams and expenses to achieve profitability and cost-efficiency targets.
	Identify opportunities to improve financial performance, including revenue generation, cost control, and operational efficiency.


Business Development &amp; Marketing:


	Drive business growth through innovative marketing, partnerships, and promotional strategies.
	Build and maintain relationships with corporate clients, travel agencies, and event planners.
	Analyze market trends and competitor activities to identify business opportunities.


Guest Experience Management:


	Ensure the highest standards of customer service and hospitality are consistently delivered.
	Oversee guest feedback systems and ensure prompt resolution of complaints.
	Promote a customer-focused culture throughout the hotel.


Human Resource &amp; Team Development:


	Lead, motivate, and manage all hotel staff to achieve operational excellence.
	Oversee recruitment, training, and performance management processes.
	Create a positive work environment that fosters teamwork, accountability, and continuous improvement.


Compliance &amp; Quality Assurance:


	Ensure all departments adhere to safety, health, and hygiene standards.
	Regularly inspect facilities and operations to ensure service quality and brand consistency.
	Implement standard operating procedures (SOPs) across departments.


Qualifications &amp; Requirements


	Bachelor&rsquo;s Degree in Hospitality Management, Business Administration, or a related field.
	Minimum of 5&ndash;7 years of experience in hotel or hospitality management, with at least 3 years in a leadership role.
	Strong financial management skills, with experience handling budgets and profit &amp; loss (P&amp;L) statements.
	Excellent leadership, communication, and interpersonal skills.
	Proficiency in hotel management software (PMS, Opera, or similar systems) preferred.
	Strong organizational and decision-making abilities.
	Ability to work flexible hours, including weekends and holidays, as required by business operations.


Key Competencies:


	Strategic and analytical thinking
	Customer service excellence
	Financial and business acumen
	Strong leadership and team management
	Effective communication and negotiation skills
	Adaptability and problem-solving ability.


Compensation &amp; Benefits


	Monthly Salary:&nbsp;N250,000 - N300,000 (based on experience and qualifications)
	Performance-Based Incentives available
	Other benefits as per company policy.


Method of Application&nbsp;

title: Job openings at Wema Bank Plc
content:
Wema Bank Plc - Widely reputed as the longest surviving and most resilient indigenous bank in Nigeria, Wema Bank Plc has over the years, diligently offered a fully-fledged range of value-adding banking and financial advisory services to the Nigerian public.

We are recruiting to fill the following positions below:

1.) Recovery Officer, Remedial Asset Management

Job Location: Lagos

Job Summary
     

        



     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	The Legal Officer in the Remedial Asset Management Department is responsible for providing legal support in the recovery and restructuring of impaired/delinquent facilities.
	The role involves advising on legal strategies for NPL recovery, managing litigation processes, drafting and reviewing legal documents, and ensuring compliance with regulatory and contractual obligations.
	The officer works closely with internal stakeholders and external counsel to maximize recovery and minimize legal risks.


Key Responsibilities
Legal Advisory & Strategy:


	Provide legal advice on recovery strategies including restructuring, foreclosure, asset disposal, and litigation.
	Advise on legal implications of remedial actions and ensure alignment with regulatory frameworks.


Documentation & Review:


	Draft, review, and negotiate legal documents including demand notices, settlement agreements, guarantees, and court processes.
	Ensure all documentation complies with applicable laws and internal policies.


Litigation Management:


	Liaise with external solicitors and monitor progress of recovery-related litigation.
	Represent the Bank in court proceedings where necessary and ensure timely resolution of cases.


Asset Recovery Support:


	Support the execution of recovery actions including repossession of financed assets.
	Coordinate with law enforcement agencies and estate management for lawful access and recovery.


Stakeholder Engagement:


	Collaborate with Loan Monitoring and other relevant departments to develop and implement recovery strategies.
	Engage with customers and guarantors to negotiate settlements and enforce obligations.


Requirements
Educational Qualifications:


	Bachelor of Laws (LL.B) degree from a recognized institution.
	Barrister-at-Law (B.L) and current membership of the Nigerian Bar Association (NBA).
	A Master’s degree in Law (LL.M), Finance, or related field is an added advantage.


Professional Experience:


	3–5 years of post-call experience in banking, finance, or commercial law practice.
	Proven experience in debt recovery, credit remediation, or loan restructuring within a financial institution or reputable law firm.
	Strong understanding of litigation processes, enforcement procedures, and asset recovery mechanisms.
	Experience liaising with external solicitors, law enforcement agencies, and regulatory bodies.


Click here to apply online

 

 

2.) Commercial Relationship Management Officer 

Job Location: Nigeria

Role Description


	This is a full-time, on-site role based in Nigeria for a Commercial Relationship Management Officer.
	The role involves building and maintaining strong relationships with commercial clients, identifying their financial needs, and providing tailored banking solutions.
	Key responsibilities include managing client portfolios, driving revenue growth, analyzing financial data, identifying business opportunities, and ensuring exceptional customer service.
	The officer will collaborate with internal teams to deliver innovative banking solutions and achieve business objectives.


Qualifications


	Strong relationship management and customer service skills
	Proficiency in financial analysis, risk assessment, and banking operations
	Experience in business development, sales, and strategic planning
	Excellent negotiation, communication, and interpersonal skills
	Ability to work independently and handle multiple client portfolios
	Bachelor's degree in Business, Finance, Economics, or related fields
	Prior experience in a commercial banking environment is an advantage.
